headline: Trump announces 100% chip tariff as Apple ups U.S. investment
summary: Investing.com -- President Donald Trump announced a 100% tariff on chips and semiconductors built outside the United States, a sweeping escalation in trade policy targeting global technology supply chains. The tariffs, unveiled during a press conference at the White House with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) CEO Time Cook, will spare companies that are actively building or have pledged to build chip infrastructure within the U.S.

headline: Exclusive-US lawmaker questions Intel CEO's ties to China in letter to company board chair
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -U.S. Republican Senator Tom Cotton sent a letter to Intel's board chair on Wednesday with questions about the chipmaker's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan's ties to Chinese firms and a recent criminal case involving his former company Cadence Design.  Writing to "express concern about the security and integrity of Intel's operations and its potential impact on U.S. national security", Cotton asked in the letter to Intel chairperson Frank Yeary whether the company's board was aware of the subpoenas sent to Cadence during Tan's time there as CEO before Intel hired him.  He also asked whether Intel's board required Tan to divest from chip firms in China linked to the Chinese military or Communist Party, and if Tan adequately disclosed other ties to Chinese companies due to Intel's involvement in the Secure Enclave program, an initiative designed under the Biden administration to ensure a secure supply of microelectronics for defense.

raw.headline: Exclusive-US lawmaker questions Intel CEO's ties to China in letter to company board chair
raw.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -U.S. Republican Senator Tom Cotton sent a letter to Intel's board chair on Wednesday with questions about the chipmaker's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan's ties to Chinese firms and a recent criminal case involving his former company Cadence Design.  Writing to "express concern about the security and integrity of Intel's operations and its potential impact on U.S. national security", Cotton asked in the letter to Intel chairperson Frank Yeary whether the company's board was aware of the subpoenas sent to Cadence during Tan's time there as CEO before Intel hired him.  He also asked whether Intel's board required Tan to divest from chip firms in China linked to the Chinese military or Communist Party, and if Tan adequately disclosed other ties to Chinese companies due to Intel's involvement in the Secure Enclave program, an initiative designed under the Biden administration to ensure a secure supply of microelectronics for defense.

headline: Gaming GPU Industry Report 2025 | Push for High Frame Rates and 4K/8K Resolution Propels Demand for Advanced Graphics Processing Units
summary: Offering a detailed analysis, the report covers key trends, drivers, and market forecasts, essential for informed business decisions. Highlighted are the latest global tariff impacts on the market. Gaming GPUs are critical for rendering lifelike graphics and powering immersive experiences, essential for VR, AR, and cloud gaming. Major growth is noted in both dedicated and integrated segments, with a spotlight on the U.S. and China's growth trajectory. Key players include AMD, NVIDIA, and Intel.
